alert.note: Alert for George (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 12:09AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama, including the following counties, Mobile and Washington and southeast Mississippi, including the following counties, George and Greene. * WHEN...Until 315 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1208 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lucedale, Leakesville, Deer Park, Earlville, Pisgah, Evanston, Shipman, Dueitt, Vaughn, Boothetown, Rounsaville, Moffet, Walley, Bexley, Agricola, Burbank, Movella, Crossroads, Dwight and Vinegar Bend. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
